org.gearvrf

Class GVRExternalScene

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRComponent
        • org.gearvrf.GVRBehavior
          • org.gearvrf.GVRExternalScene
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GVRDrawFrameListener

    public class GVRExternalScene
extends GVRBehavior
    Component which loads an asset under it's owner. This allows you to reference external assets from your scene more easily and defer their loading.
    See Also:
    GVRAssetLoader

    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRExternalScene

        public GVRExternalScene(GVRContext ctx,
                        java.lang.String filePath,
                        boolean replaceScene)
        Constructs an external scene component to load the given asset file.
        Parameters:
        ctx - GVRContext that owns this component
        filePath - full path to the asset to load
        replaceScene - true to replace the current scene, false to just add the model

      • GVRExternalScene

        public GVRExternalScene(GVRResourceVolume volume,
                        boolean replaceScene)
        Constructs an external scene component to load the given asset file.
        Parameters:
        volume - GVRResourceVolume containing the path of the asset.
        replaceScene - true to replace the current scene, false to just add the model

        Constructs an external scene component to load the given asset file.
        Parameters:
        volume - GVRResourceVolume containing the path of the asset.
        settings - import settings
        replaceScene - true to replace the current scene, false to just add the model

    • Method Detail

      • getComponentType

        public static long getComponentType()

      • replaceScene

        public boolean replaceScene()
        Determines whether the loaded asset should replace the whole scene or not.
        Returns:
        true to replace scene, false to just load the model into the current scene.

      • getFilePath

        public java.lang.String getFilePath()
        Gets the path to the asset to be loaded by this component. If the path begins with "http:" or "https:" it is assumed to be a URL. If it starts with "sd:", it references assets on the SD card. Otherwise assets are assumed to be in the "assets" directory.
        Returns:
        path to external asset

      • getAnimator

        public GVRAnimator getAnimator()
        Get the GVRAnimator containing the animations for the loaded asset.
        Returns:
        GVRAnimator if available, else null

      • getCameraRig

        public GVRCameraRig getCameraRig()
        Get the GVRCameraRig for the main camera of the loaded asset.
        Returns:
        camere rig of main camera or null if not available

      • load

        public boolean load(GVRScene scene)
        Loads the asset referenced by the file name under the owner of this component. If this component was constructed to replace the scene with the asset, the scene will contain only the owner of this component upon return. Otherwise, the loaded asset is a child of this component's owner. Loading the asset is performed in a separate thread. This function returns before the asset has finished loading. IAssetEvents are emitted to the event listener on the context.
        Parameters:
        scene - scene to add the model to, null is permissible
        Returns:
        always true

      • load

        public void load(IAssetEvents handler)
        Loads the asset referenced by the file name under the owner of this component. If this component was constructed to replace the scene with the asset, the main scene of the current context will contain only the owner of this component upon return. Otherwise, the loaded asset is a child of this component's owner. Loading the asset is performed in a separate thread. This function returns before the asset has finished loading. IAssetEvents are emitted to the input event handler and to any event listener on the context.
        Parameters:
        handler - IAssetEvents handler to process asset loading events
